Description: Upper body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery dinos; interior: glazed black; exterior: palmette and lotus cross, with added red.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The sherd belongs to British Museum 1888,0601.565 and 1888,0601.588.k. British Museum 1886,0401.1151 may belong to the same dinos. British Museum 1888,0601.588.k was excavated from the Sanctuary of Aphrodite. In all likelihood, this sherd most likely came from the same area, despite the fact that no specific provenance was give for it.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 39, pl. 23, no. 40)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0255) (Phase 1)
Williams 1983 / Sophilos in the British Museum (p. 32, fig. 35)
